Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly a Siana cup; interior glazed (fired red); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of confronting animals (on left, muzzle and shoulder of lion with added white dots and white teeth and part of mane in added red; on right, part of head, antler and red neck with white dots of deer).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 49)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 474, no. B818)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1327) (phase 3)
